intro: Appendicula brachiata, commonly known as the branched appendicula, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with slender, branched stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. The flowers are usually blue or purple, with five lobes, and bloom in clusters at the ends of the branches.
